message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.IR. 

The paper focuses on learning semantic word representations using multiple modalities, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes novel fusion methods that involve learning weights, which is a common technique in machine learning and optimization, suggesting that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely sub-category. Additionally, the use of multiple modalities suggests that cs.CV (Computer Vision) may be a relevant sub-category. The paper also involves learning under weak supervision, which is a common topic in cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper involves word associations, which is a common topic in cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
